Download and process historic environmental variables from WorldClim v2.1

Source: R/get_worldclim_historic.R
get_worldclim_historic.Rd

Downloads historic climate data from WorldClim v2.1 and processes it according to the specified parameters. Supports a variety of climate variables and resolutions. Optionally clips data to a specified area of interest (AOI) and includes retry logic for download reliability.

Usage

get_worldclim_historic(
  var = "bio", res = "30s", aoi = NULL,
  retries = 3, timeout = 300
)

Arguments

var

Character. Climate variable to download. Options:

  • "bio" — Bioclimatic variables

  • "tavg" — Average temperature

  • "tmin" — Minimum temperature

  • "tmax" — Maximum temperature

  • "prec" — Precipitation

  • "srad" — Solar radiation

  • "wind" — Wind speed

  • "vapr" — Vapor pressure

Default is "bio".

res

Character. Spatial resolution of the data. Options:

  • "30s" — ~1 km (30 arc-seconds)

  • "2.5m" — ~5 km (2.5 arc-minutes)

  • "5m" — ~10 km (5 arc-minutes)

  • "10m" — ~20 km (10 arc-minutes)

Default is "30s".

aoi

An `sf` or `SpatRaster` object representing the area of interest. Default is NULL (no clipping).

retries

Integer. Number of attempts to retry download in case of failure. Default is 3.

timeout

Numeric. Download timeout in seconds. Default is 300.

Value

A `SpatRaster` object containing the selected historic climate variables, optionally clipped to the specified AOI.

References

Fick, S. E., & Hijmans, R. J. (2017). WorldClim 2: new 1-km spatial resolution climate surfaces for global land areas. International Journal of Climatology, 37(12), 4302–4315. doi:10.1002/joc.5086

Examples

# \donttest{
library(sf)
library(terra)
nc <- st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package="sf"))
#> Reading layer `nc' from data source 
#>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/sf/shape/nc.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
#> Simple feature collection with 100 features and 14 fields
#> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
#> Dimension:     XY
#> Bounding box:  xmin: -84.32385 ymin: 33.88199 xmax: -75.45698 ymax: 36.58965
#> Geodetic CRS:  NAD27
nc <- st_transform(nc, crs = 4326)

climate_historic <- get_worldclim_historic(
  var = "tmin", res = "5m", aoi = nc
)
#> No destination_dir provided. Using temporary directory: /tmp/RtmpUYwIvf
#> Error in get_worldclim_historic(var = "tmin", res = "5m", aoi = nc): res %in% c(0.5, 2.5, 5, 10) is not TRUE
# }
